definition: to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to jab/to poke/to stab/to sprain/to blunt/to fuck (vulgar)/to stand sth upright
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
puncture test

sentences.english: His most vaunted exploits were exposed as largely fictitious.
sentences.chinese: 他最自豪的功绩，戳穿后才知大抵都是虚构的。

sentences.english: Even high school students have gotten in on the action of disproving this myth.
sentences.chinese: 甚至也有中学生加入到戳穿这个谬论的队伍中来。

sentences.english: McCain was quick to knock down the lie.
sentences.chinese: 麦凯恩迅速的戳穿了这个谎言。

sentences.english: But first, let's clear up a few myths.
sentences.chinese: 但是首先让我们戳穿一些谣言。

sentences.english: They try to blow up marketing myths that debilitate companies.
sentences.chinese: 他们戳穿了那些所谓的营销神话。

sentences.english: A nail on the road punctured the tyre.
sentences.chinese: 路上的钉子把车胎戳穿了。

sentences.english: Disused tires tured or wrapped up to avoid water accumulation.
sentences.chinese: 空地上的废弃轮胎应该用针戳穿或包起来以免积水。

sentences.english: The spear went into his intestines and basically did a number on his lower half.
sentences.chinese: 长枪戳穿了他的肠子，而且基本上重创了他的下半身。

sentences.english: "My boys now call me Mum, the Myth Buster!" she said.
sentences.chinese: 我的儿子们现在叫我‘戳穿谎言的妈妈’。

definition: to expose/to uncover
to puncture/to pierce/(fig.) to destroy (the facade concealing an unpleasant reality)
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to penetrate/to see through
to uncover
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
lie
see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
to leak/to expose (sb's secret)/to spill the beans/to let the cat out of the bag
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
to tell a lie
to quibble
to tell lies
to tear/to rip
lie
